column2: do you accept three year degrees from India
column3: We accept three-year degree from universities in India if it was from an A ranked institution and you were in the first class. If you have a three-year degree from another country please email at gradanalytics@georgetown.edu

column2: what is the nominal class size each year?
column3: There are typically 100-120 students in each incoming class. However, please be assured that our class sizes remain small -- typically there are 25-35 students per classroom, so our students are ensured individual attention.

column2: According to the link, do you allow for deferral?
column3: If you decide to request a deferral, you can do so here: https://grad.georgetown.edu/deferral/. You wouldn't get denied if you request to defer. But if you change your mind you can always cancel your deferment and enroll in the current year. You can defer your start date by one year only. If you need to wait longer than that, you would have to re-apply. If you have additional queries please contact gradanalytics@georgetown.edu

column2: I’m a US citizen, but I completed my bachelors in India so will I be a domestic or an international student?
column3: Since you are a U.S. citizen, you would be considered a domestic applicant. However, because you graduated from an international institution, you will need to provide WES-evaluated transcripts.

column2: Is it possible to have a full-time job while being a full-time student?
column3: Students are strongly discouraged from doing this. You are putting both your job performance and your academic performance at risk when you attempt this.

column2: can i work full time while completing the course

column2: Are there any scholarship/ funding available for International students
column3: Our program automatically considers accepted students for merit-based scholarships which are sent alongside a student's acceptance letter. If you get accepted into our program and there is no financial scholarship mentioned then that means you did not get one. As a returning student in your second year, you will be eligible to compete for a merit-based scholarship. Most of our scholarships are the equivalent of one or two classes per year. There are Research Assistant (RA) and Teaching Assistant (TA) opportunities on campus. Assistantships are generally awarded to continuing students who have performed well academically. A number of our students have been RAs for different programs on campus, including Computer Science, Foreign Service, and Public Policy. Our program hires many of our own students as TAs each semester. You can learn about how assistantships work by visiting the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences Financial Support page.

column2: Is GMAT accepted
column3: We do accept GMAT scores. Please note GRE/GMAT is not mandatory. If you think your GMAT score will boost your application, we encourage you to send it to us! You can send the official GMAT scores using the code JT7-GJ-96

column2: Is GRE mandatory
column3: Please be aware that we do not require the GRE to be submitted as a part of the application, it is completely optional. However, if you decide to submit scores, we do accept the GRE or GMAT or GRE at home scores.

You can view previous information session recordings and slides here: https://analytics.georgetown.edu/admissions/oh_webinars/

column2: is there in-state tuition
column3: Georgetown University is a private institution and therefore there is no "in-state" tuition. The tuition per credit is the same for all students.

column2: can i send required application materials after the application deadline
column3: It is possible to update your application after you submitted it. Once you get your documents, just email them to us at this address with a note explaining your situation and we will forward it to the admissions team! Please note that the final deadline to submit all application materials is January 15.

column2: can i attend the program online
column3: The program is currently only offered in-person, but students have the option between choosing full-time or part-time. The majority of our students are full-time, but students who are also working typically choose to be part-time. Almost all classes have different sections so students can choose a time that best suits them.

column2: Can i be a part time student
column3: Yes. This is possible for students who are not on a student visa. This may be a good option for students who wish to continue their full-time job while attending the program, especially if they receive financial support from their employer. Graduate School rules state that students admitted to a master’s degree program are allowed three years from matriculation to complete all requirements for the degree. Talk to your advisor if you think you might take longer, since there are ways to get an extension.

column2: can international students enroll as part time
column3: Yes. It is possible to switch back and forth between full-time and part-time status, and many students do this depending on their desired balance of work and study. However, international students must remain on full-time status throughout and may only switch to part-time status during their last semester. In addition, students should keep in mind that they are required to complete the program within three calendar years.

column2: can i switch from part time to full time

In addition, students should keep in mind that they are required to complete the program within three calendar years.

column2: can you give me more information about the recommendation letters
column3: Our application requires 3 letters of recommendation. Recommenders can be anyone you know that you believe could help make your application stronger and can speak to your ability to succeed in the program. These typically come from professors, mentors, work managers, etc.

column2: Would this program help prepare someone to enter a field of business analytics?
column3: Yes, the courses you take as a part of this program will help you develop many of the skills you will need as a business analyst. You can review our curriculum to see if it aligns with what you are looking for.

column2: Since there is no capstone project, are there other projects within the course that would help prepare you for real-world examples?
column3: Each course has a final project at the end of the course. These are designed to help prepare students for real-world data science problems.

column2: I have already sent my scores. Can I get a confirmation if you received it
column3: You can check the status of your application materials by logging into the application portal and viewing your application checklist. Unfortunately, we in the MS DSAN program do not have access to test scores, so if you have further questions, please contact the Office of Graduate Admissions at gradmail@georgetown.edu.

column2: instructions for statement of purpose
column3: In your statement of purpose please let us know why you selected Georgetown specifically, why you want to earn a data science degree, why you think you are a good fit for our program, and why you think our program is a good fit for you. Provide any academic background, research projects, or work experience that you think has prepared you for a graduate program in data science.

column2: Does the program offer graduate courses during the summer?
column3: Yes, the Data Science & Analytics program typically offers one to two classes during summer semester. Students may also take coursework from other programs to satisfy elective requirements during the summer.

column2: can i get TOEFL waiver
column3: If you earn your degree from an accredited institution in which English is the primary language of instruction, you do not have to submit TOEFL/IELTS scores.

column2: is TOEFL mandatory
column3: If you earn your degree from an accredited institution in which English is the primary language of instruction, you do not have to submit TOEFL/IELTS scores else.

column2: Do I have to self-report my scores or send it through ETS?
column3: To report your official test scores, you will need to have your scores sent directly by the testing agency. We are unable to accept copies or unofficial score reports sent by applicants. You should request that ETS (Educational Testing Services) send your TOEFL scores to Georgetown University Graduate School of Arts and Sciences (ETS Code: 5244). You do not need to specify any departmental code.

column2: is English-proficiency mandatory to apply in your university
column3: If you earn your degree from an accredited institution in which English is the primary language of instruction, you do not have to submit TOEFL/IELTS scores.

column2: what is the minimum required TOEFL score
column3: A minimum score of 600 (paper-based test) or 250 (computer-based tests) or 100 (iBT test) on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL).

column2: Do you accept TOEFL Home Edition Test for Fall2023 applicants?
column3: Yes, we do accept the TOEFL IBT Special Home edition.

column2: Am I eligible for an English test waiver.
column3: Its applicable only if you earn a degree from an institution where the primary language of instruction is English

column2: do I need to do the international transcripts evaluation like WES on the transcripts
column3: International applicants who attended institutions outside of the United States must submit WES. You will not need to send your WES report to our school at this time; instead, you should ask WES to send the evaluation directly to you, and then you should upload the evaluation directly to the online application. An official transcript will be required if you are offered admission to the program.
